fields.title: Sandwich Name
fields.content: Description of the sandwich, including ingredients, how it’s made, and unique features.
fields.excerpt: A brief description or unique point about the sandwich.
fields.location: Country or region where the sandwich originates

fields.title: Bánh Mì
fields.content: The Bánh Mì is a delicious Vietnamese sandwich that combines crispy baguette bread with a variety of savory fillings. It typically includes pork, pâté, pickled vegetables, cilantro, jalapeños, and creamy mayonnaise. Other derivatives swap out cold cuts for different hot proteins: barbecue pork, lemongrass beef, and grilled chicken are all classic options. It's an herbaceous and affordable meal that's accessible to pretty much anyone. There’s even such a thing as dessert bánh mì; instead of the typical savory meat and veggies, you can find bánh mì kẹp kem loaded with ice cream and crushed peanuts. It's okay to eat sandwiches for every meal.
fields.excerpt: A crispy baguette filled with savory pork, pâté, pickled vegetables, and chili peppers.

fields.title: Bean Sandwich
fields.content: The popular, unpretentious West African breakfast sandwich is essentially a choose-your-own-adventure that starts with a few simple elements: red beans cooked in a spicy tomato paste with onions and myriad spices; baguettes, an essential part of most any Senegalese breakfast (and a reminder of its French occupation until 1960); and a generous helping of mayonnaise and hot sauce. From there, you can get wild and throw in eggs, potatoes, onion sauce, or even pasta. At some street vendors, it’s a little more DIY -- you go to the bakery, get the baguette, they add the magic, and wrap it in yesterday’s newspaper, giving you both a delicious sandwich AND the satisfying opportunity to finish someone else’s crossword.
fields.excerpt: A baguette loaded with red beans, spicy tomato paste, onions, and more.

fields.title: Boh Loh Yau
fields.content: Boh loh yau, also known as the humble pineapple bun, is a delectable carb bomb of butter, sugar, and more butter. The Hong Kong breakfast-staple got its name because the sugar cookie-like substance that is placed on the bread dough melts and cracks into a pineapple-like pattern during the baking process (it’s important to note that original pineapple buns don’t contain any actual pineapple). The result is a soft, pillowy bread with a crunchy sugar crust topping, which is delicious in itself. To make the boh loh yau an even bigger treat, the bun is sliced horizontally and a slab of cold butter is placed squarely in its center, making it a remarkably sweet breakfast sandwich of bread and butter.
fields.excerpt: A sweet pineapple bun filled with a slab of cold butter.

fields.title: Bombay Sandwich
fields.content: The Bombay sandwich is essentially India's vegetarian take on a classic club sandwich. Standard fillings like bacon get swapped for raw cucumber and beet slices while lettuce and mayo are traded for a layer of spiced boiled potato and plenty of zingy cilantro chutney. Tomatoes usually make an appearance, so does cheese, but you won't find any chicken or turkey in between the bread layers. And like club sandwiches, there are many variations based on personal preferences. Some make the Bombay sandwich with strips of raw green bell pepper while others add onion or even ketchup. One thing unites all of the sandwiches, however, and that is the fact that they are buttered on the outside and grilled in a sandwich press until the contents are gently warmed up and the exterior is golden brown.
fields.excerpt: A vegetarian take on the classic club sandwich with spiced boiled potato and cilantro chutney.

fields.title: Bun Kebab
fields.content: The bun kebab consists of a patty, most commonly made with ground beef or lamb, that is mixed with lentils, spices like cumin, ginger, and green chili, and an egg, then fried until crisp in ghee or oil. The cooked patty is then loaded onto a squishy-but-griddled burger bun and topped with things like onions, chutneys, tomatoes, or even an omelet. Vegetarian versions swap the meat for boiled potatoes, but the result is equally as appealing.
fields.excerpt: A patty made with ground beef or lamb, lentils, and spices, served in a griddled bun.

fields.title: Chutney Sandwich
fields.content: Chutney sandwiches, or the very Indian riff on British tea sandwiches, are made with soft white bread slathered with butter and liberally brushed with verdant green chutney made with handfuls of cilantro, green chili, and ginger. The crusts are often cut off, just like their British counterpart. Frequently, the sandwich is also layered with thinly sliced cucumber or tomato, or even slices of cheese for a good salty punch.
fields.excerpt: A sandwich with green chutney, butter, and optional veggies or cheese.

fields.title: Croquette Sando
fields.content: Korroke sandos have a myriad of textures to enjoy: the crunch of panko, the creaminess of whipped potatoes, and the fluff of plushy white bread. They’re typically topped with tangy katsu sauce and are the wonderful carb-on-carb creation you need in your life.
fields.excerpt: Panko-crusted, deep-fried potato croquettes sandwiched between soft white bread.

fields.title: Doner Kebab
fields.content: The doner kebab (doner comes from 'dondurmek,' a Turkish word for rotating roasted meat) differentiates itself both by the fact that it is served on flatbread (usually Turkish pide) with various vegetables and the ubiquitous white sauce. Its cousins include the gyro or shawarma.
fields.excerpt: Rotating roasted meat served on Turkish flatbread with vegetables and white sauce.

fields.title: Falafel
fields.content: Falafel sandwiches are made with mashed chickpeas and spices, deep-fried and stuffed into fresh pita with pickled or fresh veggies, tahini, and hot sauce.
fields.excerpt: Deep-fried chickpea balls stuffed into pita with fresh veggies, tahini, and hot sauce.

fields.title: Fruit Sando
fields.content: Fruit sandos are a rainbow of joy laid gently upon clouds of fluffy whipped cream. It’s exactly what it sounds like: a fruit sandwich -- which can be made with all kinds of fruit, but typically features strawberries, kiwis, and peaches -- sliced evenly and layered between subtly sweet cream in a way that allows the three distinct colors to shine within the cross section of the sammie. In Japan, fruit sandos can be found in convenience stores with availability -- and types of sandos -- dependent on the season. What remains a constant is the whipped cream and the fluffy white bread, with crusts trimmed, that encase the juicy produce. Is it dessert? Is it breakfast? It doesn't matter, we're still eating it.
fields.excerpt: A fruit sandwich featuring strawberries, kiwis, and peaches, layered with whipped cream.

fields.title: Gatsby
fields.content: In 1976, fish shop owner Rashaad Pandy realized he didn't have anything put together to feed some day workers. So he threw what he did have on hand, described in a Cape Town Magazine story as 'a round Portuguese roll, polony, slap chips and achar' and sliced it up for everyone. One of the workers called it 'a Gatsby smash' (the movie version, starring Robert Redford, was playing at the time locally) and all of them lavished the improvised sandwich with praise, so Pandy put it on his menu with the name Gatsby, and it took off. These days, the sandwich is one of Cape Town's most famous exports, still served with polony (essentially bologna), fries, and achar (hot sauce commonly made with green mango and chili).
fields.excerpt: A Cape Town-born sandwich made with polony, fries, and achar, served on Portuguese bread.

fields.title: Katsu Sando
fields.content: Panko-crusted pork cutlets are already amazing on their own. But brush on some katsu sauce, add crunchy chopped cabbage, and sandwich the whole thing between fluffy shokupan bread and you’re on the brink of genius. This Japanese sandwich is a brilliant combination of flavors and textures -- juicy, crispy, meaty, and creamy -- that results in a compact meal that hits all the right notes.
fields.excerpt: A panko-crusted pork cutlet sandwich, layered with crunchy cabbage and katsu sauce.

fields.title: Kaya Toast
fields.content: Toasted bread gets topped with kaya -- a thick, luxurious, and eggy coconut jam flavored with fragrant pandan leaf -- and butter. Often served with a side of soft-boiled eggs topped with dark soy dipping sauce, this sandwich offers a sweet-salty-savory effect that everyone should experience.
fields.excerpt: A sandwich made with kaya (coconut jam), butter, and toasted bread, often served with soft-boiled eggs.

fields.title: Khao Jee
fields.content: The khao jee is a Laotian baguette sandwich featuring herbaceous pork sausage (sai gog) with ingredients like lemongrass, garlic, ginger, and fish sauce. It's typically dressed with chili sauce and served with pickled carrots, onions, and cilantro. A flavorful take on the classic bánh mì.
fields.excerpt: A Laotian baguette sandwich filled with herbaceous pork sausage and dressed with chili sauce.

fields.title: Moo Yong Sandwich
fields.content: Moo Yong, or dried pork sung, is often paired with congee but becomes a delicious breakfast sandwich when paired with white bread, smeared with chili oil, mayo, or drizzled with condensed milk. It can be savory with eggs and scallions or sweet with mayo or condensed milk.
fields.excerpt: A Thai breakfast sandwich featuring dried pork sung, mayo, or chili oil on white bread.

fields.title: Pakistani Club
fields.content: The Pakistani club sandwich is a layered affair with spicy chicken cooked with turmeric, garlic, and red chili powder, and an omelet. Served with mayo, tomatoes, and cucumbers, this hearty sandwich is typically cut into triangles and served with fries.
fields.excerpt: A layered sandwich with spicy chicken, an omelet, and served with fries.

fields.title: Pork Belly Bao
fields.content: The gua bao, or pork belly bao, is a traditional Chinese and Taiwanese snack made with smooth, steamed buns filled with tender pork belly, pickled mustard greens, ground peanuts, and cilantro, creating a balanced combination of flavors and textures.
fields.excerpt: A steamed bun filled with tender pork belly, pickled mustard greens, peanuts, and cilantro.

fields.title: Pork Chop Bun
fields.content: The Macanese pork chop bun is a hot, juicy pork chop (sometimes with the bone still in) served between Portuguese bread. The pork is typically pan-fried for a crispy exterior and juicy interior, and served with optional toppings like mayo, lettuce, and tomatoes.
fields.excerpt: A pork chop served between Portuguese bread, often with mayo, lettuce, and tomatoes.

fields.title: Roti John
fields.content: Roti john gets its name from roti -- the Malay and Hindi word for flatbread -- and john, in reference to the western colonial rule that brought baguettes (a large component of the roti john) to Malaysia. A roti john is an omelet sandwich consisting of minced meats (typically chicken), onions, and eggs. The omelet portion of the sandwich can be cooked first, with the bread submerged in the eggy mixture in the middle of cooking, or pan-fried all at once in a method that is similar to cooking French toast. Mayonnaise, ketchup, and chili sauce are then generously squeezed on top -- for a creamy, sweet, and spicy balance to the savory sandwich -- and variants include sardines, salad, cheese, and serundeng, or spicy fried coconut flakes.
fields.excerpt: A Malaysian omelet sandwich with minced meats, eggs, and a balance of mayonnaise, ketchup, and chili sauce.

fields.title: Sabich
fields.content: The sabich, a beloved Israeli sandwich, traditionally features a soft pita stuffed with crisp slices of fried eggplant, crunchy pickles, a thick swipe of hummus, a drizzle of tahini, a cucumber and tomato salad, hard-boiled eggs, and some amba, a flavorful pickled mango sauce. This hearty vegetarian option hails from Tel Aviv, created by the city's Iraqi-Jewish community, and has become a popular choice for lunch, dinner, or a snack.
fields.excerpt: A hearty Israeli pita stuffed with fried eggplant, pickles, hummus, tahini, and hard-boiled eggs.

fields.title: Shawarma
fields.content: Shawarma is a Middle Eastern favorite that traces its origins to the Ottoman Empire. It features slow-roasted meat (usually lamb, chicken, or beef) shaved off a vertical spit, served on pita or flatbread. Toppings and spice blends vary by region, but common additions include tabbouleh, fattoush, and tahini. The spices often include clove, cinnamon, cardamom, and coriander, and shawarma is a key influence behind Mexico's tacos al pastor.
fields.excerpt: A Middle Eastern sandwich with slow-roasted meat, tahini, and various regional toppings.

fields.title: Spicy Lamb Burger
fields.content: The spicy lamb burger originates from Xi’an, the capital of Shaanxi province in northwestern China. Known for its spicy and herbaceous flavors, this sandwich features lamb cooked with cumin, chili seeds, and peppers, served on a Chinese flatbread. The spicy lamb burger is a variation of rou jia mo, which dates back to 220 BC and is one of the oldest sandwiches in the world.
fields.excerpt: A spicy lamb burger from Xi'an, served on traditional Chinese flatbread with cumin and chili.

fields.title: Taiwanese Breakfast Sandwich
fields.content: The Taiwanese breakfast sandwich is a triple-decker filled with layers of eggs, ham, cucumbers, and greens. Each layer of fluffy white bread is slathered with creamy mayonnaise, and the sandwich is often sold pre-packaged in plastic for an easy grab-and-go breakfast.
fields.excerpt: A triple-decker breakfast sandwich with eggs, ham, cucumbers, and mayo, served on fluffy white bread.

fields.title: Vada Pav
fields.content: The vada pav is a popular sandwich in Mumbai, where spiced potato patties are deep-fried and served in a soft, grilled bun with chutney. Originally invented as a meal for textile workers, it has become a favorite among all, from college students to Bollywood stars. Variants include nacho vada pav and chef David Chang's version with scallion sauce.
fields.excerpt: A spiced potato patty sandwich served in a grilled bun with chutney, originally from Mumbai.

fields.title: Vegemite
fields.content: Vegemite is an iconic Australian spread made from yeast extract and used to top buttered toast. It's a salty, bitter, umami-rich paste that has become a household staple. Typically served with additional toppings, it was famously referenced in the 1980s song 'Down Under' by Men at Work.
fields.excerpt: A thick, umami-rich yeast extract spread traditionally used on toast in Australia.

fields.title: BLT
fields.content: The BLT, featuring bacon, lettuce, and tomato on toasted bread with mayonnaise, has an origin that stretches back to the 19th century in England. It was initially a simpler version of the club sandwich and has since become a universally loved sandwich, especially in the UK and the U.S.
fields.excerpt: A classic bacon, lettuce, and tomato sandwich, often considered an iconic treat.

fields.title: Bocadillo
fields.content: The bocadillo is a Spanish sandwich made with a variety of fillings, typically served in a baguette. Popular variations include serranito with pork loin and jamón serrano, or esgarraet with red pepper salad and cod. The key to a bocadillo is a crunchy, flaky exterior and soft, fluffy interior.
fields.excerpt: A versatile Spanish sandwich served in a baguette with a variety of fillings.

fields.title: Breakfast Roll
fields.content: The breakfast roll is the portable version of the traditional full Irish breakfast. It combines rashers of bacon, sausages, black/white pudding, and fried eggs into a French roll. Sometimes, tomatoes, hash browns, mushrooms, and baked beans are included. It's essentially an Irish breakfast burrito, beloved across the country for its hangover-curing properties.
fields.excerpt: An Irish breakfast rolled into a French roll with bacon, sausages, eggs, and more.

fields.title: Broodje Kroket
fields.content: The broodje kroket is a Dutch favorite made of a breaded and fried minced meat or potato croquette, typically served in a soft white bun with spicy brown mustard. It's a snack served widely across the Netherlands, available in snack bars, fast-food joints, and even McDonald's. The kroket is an iconic snack, often eaten on the go.
fields.excerpt: A fried croquette filled with minced meat or potatoes, served in a soft bun with mustard.

fields.title: Carrozza
fields.content: The carrozza, also known as mozzarella in carrozza, is an Italian fried sandwich filled with melted mozzarella cheese. Typically made with white bread, it's dipped in an egg wash and fried until golden. A staple in the Campania region, it’s the perfect sandwich for anyone who loves mozzarella sticks in sandwich form.
fields.excerpt: A deliciously fried sandwich filled with gooey mozzarella cheese.

fields.title: Cevapcici
fields.content: Cevapcici, a popular street food across the Balkans, consists of spiced minced meat sausages (usually beef or lamb) served in flatbread with onions, kajmak (a cheese spread), and ajvar (a red pepper sauce). The savory, flavorful sausages are charcoal-grilled and are perfect for a late-night snack or a hearty meal.
fields.excerpt: Charcoal-grilled sausages made from minced meat and served in flatbread with cheese spread and pepper sauce.

fields.title: Chip Butty
fields.content: The chip butty is an iconic British sandwich made with thick-cut French fries (chips) stuffed between two slices of buttered white bread. It's an indulgent, no-frills comfort food that is sometimes served with a bit of ketchup or vinegar. It’s the ultimate hangover cure, beloved across the UK.
fields.excerpt: A no-frills sandwich made with buttered bread and thick French fries.

fields.title: Coronation Chicken
fields.content: Coronation chicken is a curried chicken salad that was created for the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1953. It typically includes chicken, curry powder, mayonnaise, and dried fruit such as apricots or raisins, along with toasted almonds. This elegant sandwich became a staple for fancy sandwiches in the UK.
fields.excerpt: Curried chicken salad with dried fruit and toasted almonds, created for Queen Elizabeth II's coronation.

fields.title: Croque Monsieur
fields.content: The Croque Monsieur is a French grilled ham and cheese sandwich that’s topped with béchamel sauce and broiled until golden brown. This indulgent sandwich can be upgraded into a Croque Madame by adding a fried egg on top. It’s a staple of French cafés and a comforting classic of French cuisine.
fields.excerpt: A French grilled ham and cheese sandwich, topped with béchamel sauce and optionally crowned with an egg.

fields.title: Cucumber Sandwich
fields.content: The cucumber sandwich is a classic English tea-time treat made with thinly sliced cucumbers, buttered white bread, and a sprinkle of salt. The crusts are usually cut off to give it a refined look. These sandwiches are simple, refreshing, and a staple of afternoon tea in the UK.
fields.excerpt: A simple sandwich made with thinly sliced cucumbers, buttered bread, and a dash of salt.

fields.title: Francesinha
fields.content: The Francesinha, meaning 'little Frenchie,' is a Portuguese version of the French croque monsieur. It typically features layers of ham, sausage, and steak, covered with melted cheese and smothered in a rich, tangy beer-tomato sauce. Some versions even include a fried egg on top. It's a messy but delicious sandwich from Porto, Portugal.
fields.excerpt: A Portuguese sandwich with layers of meat, melted cheese, and a tangy beer-tomato sauce.

fields.title: Gyro
fields.content: The gyro is a classic Greek street food consisting of shaved roasted meat (typically pork, chicken, or lamb) served in pita bread with tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki sauce. It’s similar to the Turkish doner and Middle Eastern shawarma but has its own distinct flavor and is beloved around the world.
fields.excerpt: A Greek street food made with roasted meat, tzatziki sauce, and vegetables in pita bread.

fields.title: Jambon Beurre
fields.content: The Jambon Beurre is a classic French sandwich made with just three ingredients: ham, butter, and a baguette. This simple yet delicious sandwich is famous for its perfect balance of salty ham and creamy butter, all enclosed in a fresh, crusty baguette. It’s a popular choice for a quick lunch or snack in Paris and can be found everywhere, from street vendors to high-end cafés.
fields.excerpt: A simple yet flavorful French sandwich with ham, butter, and a fresh baguette.

fields.title: Leberkäse
fields.content: Leberkäse is a Bavarian specialty made from finely ground pork and corned beef, seasoned and baked into a loaf with a golden brown crust. Sliced like meatloaf, it is traditionally served on a hard or soft roll with mustard. This sandwich, which translates to 'liver cheese,' is a beloved comfort food in Germany, with variations that sometimes include cheese or peppers.
fields.excerpt: A savory Bavarian meatloaf sandwich made with ground pork and corned beef, served with mustard.

fields.title: Mitraillette
fields.content: The Mitraillette is a hearty Belgian sandwich made by stuffing a buttered baguette with large slices of meatballs or hamburger, topped with fries, cheese, veggies, and mayo. This decadent creation, often referred to as a mutant chip butty, is a Belgian street food staple that combines crispy fries and savory meat in a delicious, messy sandwich.
fields.excerpt: A Belgian sandwich with meat, fries, veggies, cheese, and mayo stuffed in a buttered baguette.

fields.title: Pan Bagnat
fields.content: Pan Bagnat is a traditional sandwich from Nice, France, based on the classic salade niçoise. It features a round country loaf soaked in olive oil and garlic, then filled with ingredients like tomato, onion, olives, hard-boiled eggs, basil, and anchovies or tuna. The sandwich is best enjoyed after being marinated for a while, allowing the flavors to meld together.
fields.excerpt: A French sandwich with salade niçoise ingredients soaked in olive oil and garlic for extra flavor.

fields.title: Panino
fields.content: Panino, the singular form of panini, refers to a small sandwich typically made with Italian bread and grilled with various fillings. Traditional panino fillings include mortadella, salami, ham, and cheese. It's a beloved snack or lunch in Italy, with panini presses adding a satisfying crunch to the bread.
fields.excerpt: An Italian grilled sandwich made with various fillings like mortadella, salami, and cheese.

fields.title: Ploughman's Sandwich
fields.content: The Ploughman's Sandwich is a British classic, often made with wheat bread, cheese, pickles, onions, and apples. Inspired by the Ploughman's lunch, which features cold, hearty ingredients, this sandwich is a refreshing, savory snack, with variations including the addition of Branston pickle or arugula.
fields.excerpt: A hearty sandwich made with cheese, pickles, onions, and apples, inspired by the Ploughman's lunch.

fields.title: Porilainen
fields.content: The Porilainen is a Finnish sandwich that blends the best of a hamburger and hot dog. It features a hamburger-like patty in a hot dog-style bun, topped with pickles, onions, ketchup, and mustard. Invented in the Finnish city of Pori, it’s a unique and flavorful snack loved by locals.
fields.excerpt: A hamburger-hot dog fusion sandwich from Finland, topped with pickles, onions, ketchup, and mustard.

fields.title: Tramezzino
fields.content: Tramezzini are Italian crustless sandwiches, often triangular in shape and filled with ingredients like egg salad, prosciutto, and anchovies. These neat, bite-sized sandwiches are commonly served as snacks in cafés or train stations in Italy and are perfect for a quick bite on the go.
fields.excerpt: A crustless, triangular Italian sandwich filled with egg salad, prosciutto, and more.

fields.title: Bake and Shark
fields.content: Bake and Shark is a Trinidadian sandwich made with a fried, hollow flatbread stuffed with seasoned and breaded shark meat. It’s often topped with various condiments like garlic sauce, pepper sauce, and coleslaw. Popular on Maracas Beach in Trinidad, it’s one of the island’s most famous beach snacks.
fields.excerpt: A Trinidadian sandwich made with fried flatbread and breaded shark meat, topped with sauces and coleslaw.

fields.title: Barros Luco
fields.content: Barros Luco is a simple but delicious Chilean sandwich consisting of steak and melted cheese on a roll. Named after Chile's former president, Ramón Barros Luco, this sandwich is beloved for its simplicity, featuring juicy steak paired with gooey Chilean mantecoso cheese.
fields.excerpt: A simple Chilean sandwich with steak and melted cheese, named after the country's former president.

fields.title: Bauru
fields.content: Bauru is a popular Brazilian sandwich named after the city of Bauru. It features a French roll filled with beef, tomatoes, mozzarella, and pickles, then steamed to achieve a melty, delicious filling. It’s a beloved snack in Brazil, often enjoyed at cafés or food stands.
fields.excerpt: A Brazilian sandwich filled with beef, tomatoes, mozzarella, and pickles, served in a French roll.
